title: Grain Storage | Storage Hygiene and Structural Treatments

tasks.task: Participate in a grain storage hygiene and structural cleanings webinar.
subtasks: Engage in morning greetings and introductions.
Present an overview of the webinar's topic.
Refer to personal experience and background in grain storage extension.
Explain the Q&A process during the webinar.
Acknowledge the support of the BCG in facilitating the session.

tasks.task: Discuss the importance of on-farm storage hygiene and structural treatments.
subtasks: Explain the relationship between hygiene, structural treatments, and pest prevention.
Present research on the rapid breeding of pests in grain storage environments.
Describe the life cycle and breeding potential of grain pests.
Identify common pest habitats on farms and in grain storage structures.
Discuss hygiene measures for grain storage, including cleaning equipment and structures.
Evaluate the design and cleanliness of grain storage facilities.
Recommend proper grain storage design for easier maintenance and hygiene.

tasks.task: Describe the application of diatomaceous earth (DE) as a structural treatment.
subtasks: Explain the mechanism of action for DE in pest control.
Provide guidelines for applying DE in grain storage facilities.
Discuss the effectiveness of DE in different environments and its duration.
Address concerns and considerations when using DE in grain storage.
Suggest additional measures for high-value commodities.

tasks.task: Address questions and provide further information on grain storage hygiene and treatments.
subtasks: Respond to audience inquiries about DE use and application.
Recommend resources for additional information and support.
Announce details of an upcoming webinar on upgrading existing storage.
Express gratitude to participants and hosts.
